[REDACTED] example, you mention that your data will be made available as open data, but later you rightly mention [REDACTED] to privacy reasons we will not share transcripts or audio recordings from focus groups, interviews and roundtable discussions.” [REDACTED] make a more clear distinction of which data you plan to make openly available on OSF (or another repository) with a CC-BY license (which is for openly available data) and which data you will not share or only share on request? - [REDACTED] pseudonymized data are still considered to be personal data, often only anonymized data can be made openly available and pseudonymized data can be shared on request (users need to request access and then a data sharing agreement is drawn up together with the legal department). [REDACTED] the PRET team for advice if in doubt whether sharing data violates privacy rights. - [REDACTED] you use OSF, choose the [REDACTED] - [REDACTED] storage location to store the data of your OSF project as this is safer GDPR wise, see https://help.osf.io/article/236-set-a-global-storage-location - [REDACTED] using the KU [REDACTED] [REDACTED] [REDACTED] [REDACTED] RDR (rdr.kuleuven.be).
